members.name: components
members.comment: All the components that the screen contains; components are handled separately from the screen

members.name: container
members.comment: The display that contains this screen

members.name: this
members.comment: It may be useful for a screen to have access to it's containing display

members.name: handleEvent
members.comment:
How the screen should respond to events
 Is necessary because it is an event handler

members.name: draw
members.comment:
How the screen should be drawn
 Drawing of screen components is handled after this method

members.name: update
members.comment:
What the screen should do every screen update
 If the renderer is on VSync, update may be called more than once per actual frame
 Can be treated as the insides of a while(true) loop

members.name: Activity
members.comment:
An object that represents an Activity or a Screen or a point in time of the display
 Draws itself to the screen, can handle events, and can contain components which do the same
 Adding components to an activity ensures that they will automatically get handled as long as the activity is active

members.name: _location
members.comment: Where the button is on the screen

members.name: isClicked
members.comment: Gets whether the mouse button is held down over this button

members.name: isHovered
members.comment: Gets whether the mouse is hovering over this button

members.name: location
members.comment: Gets where the button is on the screen

members.name: location
members.comment: Sets where the button is on the screen

members.name: this
members.comment: Makes a button given its location

members.name: handleEvent
members.comment:
How the button determines when it has been pressed
 Collects events and if the events signify the button has been pressed, calls the button's action

members.name: Button
members.comment:
A predefined component that may be used as one would normally expect
 Ensures that the mouse was clicked and released over the button
 Button doesn't handle timing of press or anything like that

members.name: container
members.comment: The display that contains this component

members.name: this
members.comment: It may be useful for a component to have access to it's containing display

members.name: location
members.comment: Gets where the component is on the screen

members.name: draw
members.comment: How the component should draw itself on the screen

members.name: Component
members.comment: A component defines something that can be drawn, handle events, and takes up a space on the screen

members.name: subComponents
members.comment: The components that are in this ComponentGroup

members.name: location
members.comment: Gets the location of this group as the smallest rectangle that contains all components

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a ComponentGroup given the component-required Display as well as what sub components are in the group
 Unexpected behaviour may stem if the components in the component group aren't all of the same Display

members.name: handleEvent
members.comment:
The group handles events by sending events to the sub components
 Components recieve events in the same order they are in the group

members.name: draw
members.comment:
The group handles drawing by just drawing all of the sub components
 Components are drawn in the order they are in the group; later components go on top of earlier components

members.name: ComponentGroup
members.comment:
A ComponentGroup is just a way of grouping a bunch of related components into one singular group
 From there, a ComponentGroup functions exactly as any other normal component would
 Unexpected behaviour may stem if the components in the component group aren't all of the same Display

members.name: Display
members.comment:
A display that handles collecting events and drawing to the activity and handling window stuff
 Will handle the main loop and send events to where they need to be handled

members.name: frameSleep
members.comment: How long to wait between frames in milliseconds; will be ignored in case of VSync

members.name: isRunning
members.comment: Whether the display is running; will stop running if set to false

members.name: activity
members.comment: The activity that the display is displaying right now

members.name: eventHandlers
members.comment: All event handlers of the display; define specific behaviours for events; events pass to handlers from first to last

members.name: framerate
members.comment: Sets the window's framerate

members.name: framerate
members.comment: Gets the window's framerate

members.name: frames
members.comment: Gets how many frames have passed since the window started

members.name: keyboard
members.comment: Gets the keyboard of the display

members.name: mouse
members.comment: Gets the mouse of the display

members.name: window
members.comment: Gets the window of the display

members.name: renderer
members.comment: Gets the contained window's renderer

members.name: this
members.comment:
Constructs a display given a width, height, window flags, renderer flags, a title, and a path for an image icon (or null)
 Disregarding width and height, constructor asks for flags first because once set, those cannot be changed
members.originalType: (int w, int h, SDL_WindowFlags flags = SDL_WINDOW_SHOWN, uint rendererFlags = 0, string title = "", string iconPath = null)

members.name: run
members.comment: Actually runs the display and handles event collection and framerate and most other things

members.name: initialPoint
members.comment: The initial or starting point of the AABB

members.name: extent
members.comment: The extent in each direction the AABB extends from the initial point (eg.)

members.name: topLeft
members.comment: Gives the AABB convenient 2d aliases

members.name: topRight
members.comment: Gives the AABB convenient 2d aliases

members.name: bottomLeft
members.comment: Gives the AABB convenient 2d aliases

members.name: bottomRight
members.comment: Gives the AABB convenient 2d aliases

members.name: vertices
members.comment: Gets all the vertices of the AABB

members.name: edges
members.comment: Gets all the edges of the AABB

members.name: center
members.comment: Gets the point that is the middle or center of the AABB

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates an AABB from the initial point, and how much in each direction the box extends

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates an AABB from the same as the vector constructor, but as a varargs input

members.name: this
members.comment: Copy constructor for AABBs

members.name: contains
members.comment: Returns whether the box contains the given point

members.name: AxisAlignedBoundingBox
members.comment:
A rectangle is a box in 2d space
 Because these rectangles are axis aligned, they don't have any rotation

members.name: intersects
members.comment: Returns whether two rectangles intersect

members.name: controlPoints
members.comment: The points that control the path of the curve; usually don't actually exist on curve

members.name: getPoints
members.comment: Gets numPoints amount of points that are on the bezier curve evenly spaced from the beginning point to the end point (t 0 => 1)

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a bezier curve given a list of control points

members.name: BezierCurve
members.comment:
A class that represents a Bezier Curve
 Supposedly the most visually appealing curves
 Needs a lot of complicated math; this class doesn't have much functionality other than what one might need to draw it

members.name: elements
members.comment: The elements of the matrix; stored as an array of rows (i.e. row vectors)

members.name: determinant
members.comment:
Recursively finds the determinant of the matrix if the matrix is square
 Task is done in O(n!) for an nxn matrix, so determinants of matrices of at most size 3x3 are already defined to be more efficient
 Not very efficient for large matrices

members.name: inverse
members.comment: Returns the inverse of a square matrix, which should give the identity if they are multiplied.

members.name: rowEchelon
members.comment:
Returns the matrix in row-echelon form
 In row-echelon form, the diagonal elements are equal to one
 and all elements below the diagonal are zero
 This method uses the Gauss-Jordan algorithm, which has arithmetic complexity O(n^3)
 Be wary of truncation for integer matrices

members.name: reducedRowEchelon
members.comment:
Returns the matrix in row-echelon form
 In reduced row-echelon form, the diagonal elements are equal to one
 and all elements below and above the diagonal are zero
 This method uses the Gauss-Jordan algorithm, which has arithmetic complexity O(n^3)
 Be wary of truncation for integer matrices

members.name: transpose
members.comment:
The transpose operation returns the matrix 'flipped' about its diagonal -
 That is, rows and columns are switched

members.name: this
members.comment:
Constructs a matrix from a two-dimensional array of elements
 TODO: Handle improper dimensions

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructs a matrix that is identically one value

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructs a matrix as an identity matrix

members.name: this
members.comment: Copy constructor for a matrix; creates a copy of the given matrix

members.name: setRow
members.comment: Sets the nth row of the matrix

members.name: getRow
members.comment: Returns the nth row of the matrix

members.name: setColumn
members.comment: Sets the nth column of the matrix

members.name: getColumn
members.comment: Returns the nth column of the matrix

members.name: getSlice
members.type: Matrix!(T, height, width)(uint startRow, uint startColumn)

members.name: getSlice
members.comment:
Returns a rectangular slice of the matrix with the upper left corner at the specified location
 and a specified size
 Usable to get rows and columns; just set the height or width to 1

members.name: opAssign
members.comment: Allows assigning the matrix to a static two-dimensional array to set all components of the matrix

members.name: opAssign
members.comment: Allows assigning the matrix to a static two-dimensional array to set all components of the matrix

members.name: opAssign
members.comment: Allows assigning the matrix to a single value to set all elements of the matrix to such a value

members.name: opBinary
members.comment:
Multiplication of a matrix by a vector
 This is essentially a matrix multiplication, but is handled separately for convenience
 If Vector is made to extend Matrix in the future, this will become obsolete

members.name: opBinary
members.type: Matrix!(T, rows, columns)(Matrix!(T, rows, columns) other)

members.name: opBinary
members.comment:
Pairwise operations on matrices
 Addition: Adds all elements
 Multiplication: Mulitplies all elements - this is known as the Hadamard Product
 etc.

members.name: opBinary
members.comment: Pairwise operations on matrices with a constant

members.name: toString
members.comment: Returns the matrix as a string

members.name: Matrix
members.comment:
A matrix is just like a mathematical matrix where it is similar to essentially a 2d array of of the given type
 Template parameters are the type, how many rows, and how many columns
 TODO:frustums, transformations, speed everything up with parallelism

members.name: multiply
members.type: Matrix!(T, rows1, columns2)(Matrix!(T, rows1, sharedDimension) lhs, Matrix!(T, sharedDimension, columns2) rhs)

members.name: multiply
members.comment: Takes the product of two matrices with a shared dimension

members.name: augment
members.type: Matrix!(T, rows, columns1 + columns2)(Matrix!(T, rows, columns1) lhs, Matrix!(T, rows, columns2) rhs)

members.name: augment
members.comment:
Returns an augmented matrix consisting of two matrices with the same number of rows
 Useful for inverse calculations and solving linear systems of equations

members.name: rotationMatrixOf
members.comment:
Returns a rotation matrix for a given radian input
 A rotation matrix is a matrix that, when multiplied by the column vector of a given point, rotates that point clockwise by the given angle

members.name: translationMatrixOf
members.comment:
Returns a translation matrix for a given x and y input
 The translation matrix, when multiplied by the column vector of a point with an additional row of [1.0], will return the column vector of the translated point with an additional row of [1.0]

members.name: initial
members.comment: The initial point (the vector points to the initial point)

members.name: terminal
members.comment: The terminal point (the vector points to the terminal point)

members.name: direction
members.comment: Returns the direction of the segment from initial to terminal

members.name: this
members.comment:
Constructor for a segment;
 Takes in the initial point and the terminal point

members.name: contains
members.comment:
Returns whether this segment contains the other point
 Checks that a segment from origin to point has magnitude between initial and terminal's magnitude
 Also checks that when point magnitude is 1 and direction magnitude is 1, they have the same or they have negated components

members.name: Segment
members.comment: A segment class that is defined by two

members.name: interesction
members.type: Vector!(T, dimensions)(Segment!(T, dimensions) first, Segment!(T, dimensions) second)

members.name: interesction
members.comment: TODO: Returns where two segments intersect; if they don't intersect, returns null; needs rref of matrix to be completed first

members.name: components
members.comment: The components of the vector

members.name: x
members.comment: The components of the vector

members.name: y
members.comment: The components of the vector

members.name: z
members.comment: The components of the vector

members.name: w
members.comment: The components of the vector

members.name: directionAngles
members.comment:
Sets the angles of the vector where the angles are given in radians
 Angles are direction angles (eg. first angle is direction from x, second is direction from y, etc...)
 0 goes along the positive axis

members.name: directionAngles
members.comment:
Gets the angles of the vector where the angles are given in radians
 Angles are direction angles (eg. first angle is direction from x, second is direction from y, etc...)
 0 goes along the positive axis

members.name: magnitude
members.comment:
Sets the length of the vector
 Maintains component ratios of the vector

members.name: magnitude
members.comment: Gets the length of the vector

members.name: this
members.comment: A vector constructor; takes in the number of args given and assigns them as components

members.name: this
members.comment: A vector constructor; takes in a value that acts as both vector components

members.name: this
members.comment: A constructor that sets all elements to 0

members.name: this
members.comment: A copy constructor for a vector; makes the same vector, but as a different instance

members.name: opAssign
members.comment: Allows assigning the vector to a static array to set all components of the vector

members.name: opAssign
members.comment: Allows assigning the vector to a single value to set all elements of the vector to such a value

members.name: opOpAssign
members.comment:
Allows the vector to have the joint operator assign syntax
 Works component-wise (eg. (3, 2, 1) += (1, 2, 3) makes (3, 2, 1) into (4, 4, 4))

members.name: opOpAssign
members.comment:
Allows the vector to have the joint operator assign syntax
 Works component-wise, so each operation of the constant is applied to each component

members.name: opOpAssign
members.comment:
Allows the vector to have the joint operator assign syntax
 Works component-wise, so each operation of the constant is applied to each component

members.name: opCast
members.comment: Casts the vector to a vector of another type

members.name: opUnary
members.comment: Allows unary functions to be applied to the vector; aplies the same operator to all components

members.name: opBinary
members.comment:
Allows the vector to be used with normal operators
 Works component-wise (eg. (3, 2, 1) + (1, 2, 3) = (4, 4, 4))

members.name: opBinary
members.comment:
Allows the vector to be used with normal operators
 Works component-wise (eg. (3, 2, 1) + (1, 2, 3) = (4, 4, 4))

members.name: opBinary
members.comment:
Allows the vector to be used with normal operators
 Works component-wise, so each operation of the constant is applied to each component

members.name: toString
members.comment:
Gives the vector a pretty string format
 (eg. (1, 2, 3) => <1, 2, 3>)

members.name: opEquals
members.comment:
Returns whether the vector is equal to another vector or constant
 Uses approxEquals to do easy equality for vectors of doubles

members.name: apply
members.comment: Applies the given function to each element of the vector

members.name: apply
members.comment: Applies the given function to each element of the vector and returns the results in a new vector

members.name: Vector
members.comment:
A vector is an object representing distance in vertical and horizontal directions in multidimensional space
 Components are the first template parameter with the second template parameter being vector dimensionality
 Most vector operations take advantage of parallelism to do simple arithmetic on each component in parallel
 TODO: slices returning vectors, swizzling, and dispatch forwarding

members.name: dot
members.type: T(Vector!(T, dim) first, Vector!(T, dim) second)

members.name: dot
members.comment: Calculates the dot product or the similarity of two vectors

members.name: cross
members.type: Vector!(T, 3)(Vector!(T, size) first, Vector!(T, size) second)

members.name: cross
members.comment:
Calculates the cross product or the perpendicular vector to two vectors
 (with length equal to the area of the parallelogram they form)
 Currently only works on 2 or 3 dimensional vectors

members.name: Color
members.comment:
A color struct
 As of right now, only works with additive RGBA, but may work with other formats later
 Additive RGBA is where the color is stored as an addition of red, green, and blue
 Alpha is the transparency of the color

members.name: r
members.comment: Red value for the color

members.name: g
members.comment: Green value for the color

members.name: b
members.comment: Blue value for the color

members.name: a
members.comment: Alpha value or transparency for the color

members.name: handle
members.comment: Gets the color as an SDL_Color

members.name: PredefinedColor
members.comment: A list of pre-defined common colors

members.name: EventHandler
members.comment:
An interface that just defines an object that can collect and respond to sdl events
 Event handlers can be added to a display to add unique behaviour for events

members.name: handleEvent
members.comment: Takes in an SDL event and should define what behaviour should happen for specific events

members.name: Encoding
members.comment:
The three types of encoding TTF can use
 LATIN1 is the set of ASCII characters; its glyphs are represented as chars
 UTF8 is the set of "Unicode" characters; it can handle all ASCII characters as well because ASCII is a subset of Unicode
 UNICODE encoding is determined by operating system; Windows handles UNICODE using UTF16, while UNIX systems use UTF8
 Note: UNICODE is identical to UTF8 in some cases but uses ushorts to represent glyphs instead of using chars

members.name: Font
members.comment:
Fonts are contexts for displaying strings
 Fonts  describe how each character in the string looks and how they are spaced
 Each font includes a collection of supported glyphs and general information
 TODO: allow for multiline printing

members.name: handle
members.comment: Returns the raw SDL data of this object

members.name: style
members.comment:
Sets the style (bold, italic, etc.) of this font
 Style should be inputted as a bitmask composed of:
 TTF_STYLE_BOLD
 TTF_STYLE_ITALIC
 TTF_STYLE_UNDERLINE
 TTF_STYLE_STRIKETHROUGH
 If the style is normal, use TTF_STYLE_NORMAL
 For multiple styles, use a bitwise OR operator (TTF_STYLE_BOLD|TTF_STYLE_ITALIC means both bold and italic, etc.)

members.name: style
members.comment:
Gets the style (bold, italic, etc.) of this font
 Style is returned as a bitmask composed of:
 TTF_STYLE_BOLD
 TTF_STYLE_ITALIC
 TTF_STYLE_UNDERLINE
 TTF_STYLE_STRIKETHROUGH
 If the style is normal, the value returned will be TTF_STYLE_NORMAL
 Otherwise, use bitwise and operations to get individual values (style&TTF_STYLE_BOLD returns whether the font is bold, etc.)

members.name: outline
members.comment:
Sets the size of the font's outline
 Use outline = 0 to disable outlining

members.name: outline
members.comment:
Gets the size of the font's outline
 Outline is constant across glyphs in a font

members.name: hinting
members.comment:
Sets the font's hinting type
 Type is taken as a value matching one of the following:
 TTF_HINTING_NORMAL
 TTF_HINTING_LIGHT
 TTF_HINTING_MONO
 TTF_HINTING_NONE
 Hinting type is how the font is programmed to map onto the pixels on a screen
 Note: the method flushes the internal cache of glyphs in the font, even if there is no change in hinting
       It may be useful to first check the font's hinting type

members.name: hinting
members.comment:
Gets the font's hinting type
 Type is returned as a value matching one of the following:
 TTF_HINTING_NORMAL
 TTF_HINTING_LIGHT
 TTF_HINTING_MONO
 TTF_HINTING_NONE
 Type defaults to TTF_HINTING_NORMAL if no type has been set
 Hinting type is how the font is programmed to map onto the pixels on a screen

members.name: kerning
members.comment:
Sets the font's kerning setting
 Default for newly created fonts is true
 Kerning setting determines whether the spacing between individual characters is adjusted for a more pleasing result

members.name: kerning
members.comment:
Gets the font's kerning setting
 Default for a newly created fonts is true
 Kerning setting determines whether the spacing between individual characters is adjusted for a more pleasing result

members.name: height
members.comment:
Gets the maximum pixel height of all glyphs in this font
 Useful for multiline printing

members.name: ascent
members.comment:
Gets the maximum pixel ascent of all glyphs in this font
 Ascent is the distance from the top of the glyph to the baseline

members.name: descent
members.comment:
Gets the maximum pixel descent of all glyphs in this font
 Descent is the distance from the bottom of the glyph to the baseline

members.name: lineSkip
members.comment:
Gets the recommended pixel height of a line of text in this font
 This represents the distance from the baseline to the top of the line
 Line skip should be larger than height in most cases

members.name: faces
members.comment:
Gets the number of faces in this font
 Faces are sub-fonts that vary slightly from the main font

members.name: isFixedWidth
members.comment:
Checks if the current font face of this font is fixed-width
 Fixed-width fonts are monospace - each character is the same length
 The pixel length of a string of fixed-width characters is the width of the characters times the amount of characters

members.name: familyName
members.comment:
Gets the font face family name (Times, Courier, etc.)
 Returns null if not available

members.name: styleName
members.comment:
Gets the font face style name (Sans, Serif, etc.)
 Returns null if not available

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructs a font from a font file

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructs a font from an already existing TTF_Font

members.name: ~this
members.comment: Ensures that SDL_TTF can dispose of this font

members.name: isProvided
members.comment: Checks if the font supports the given glyph

members.name: minimumOffset
members.comment:
Gets the minimum offset of the glyph
 Returns the bottom left corner of the rectangle in which the glyph is inscribed in Cartesian coordinates

members.name: maximumOffset
members.comment:
Gets the maximum offset of the glyph
 Returns the top right corner of the rectangle in which the glyph is inscribed in Cartesian coordinates

members.name: offset
members.comment:
Gets a rectangle describing the offset of the given glyph
 Width of the rectangle is width of the glyph

members.name: advanceOffset
members.comment:
Gets the advance offset of the glyph
 The advance offset is the distance the pen must be shifted after drawing a glyph
 Controls spacing between glyphs on an individual basis

members.name: renderTextSolid
members.comment:
Renders the text on an 8-bit palettized surface with the given color
 Background is transparent
 Text is less smooth than other render options
 This is the fastest rendering speed, and color can be changed without having to render again

parameters.name: color
parameters.default: Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)255u, SDL_Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u))

members.originalType: Surface(string text, Color color = Color(0, 0, 0), Encoding T = Encoding.UTF8)

members.name: renderTextShaded
members.comment:
Renders the text with a given color on an 8-bit palettized surface with a given background color
 Text is smooth but renders slowly
 Surface blits as fast as the Solid render method once it is made
members.originalType: Surface(string text, Color foreground, Color background, Encoding T = Encoding.UTF8)

members.name: renderTextBlended
members.comment:
Renders the text in high quality on a 32-bit ARGB surface, using alpha blending to dither the font with the given color
 The surface has alpha transparency
 Renders about as slowly as the Shaded render method, but blits more slowly than Solid and Shaded

parameters.name: color
parameters.default: Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)255u, SDL_Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u))

members.originalType: Surface(string text, Color color = Color(0, 0, 0), Encoding T = Encoding.UTF8)

members.name: renderGlyphSolid
members.comment:
Renders a glyph quickly
 See renderTextSolid

parameters.name: color
parameters.default: Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)255u, SDL_Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u))

members.name: renderGlyphShaded
members.comment:
Renders a glyph slowly but smoothly
 See renderTextShaded

members.name: renderGlyphBlended
members.comment:
Renders a glyph very slowly but with very high quality
 See renderTextBlended

parameters.name: color
parameters.default: Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)255u, SDL_Color(cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u, cast(ubyte)0u))

members.name: id
members.comment: The identifier for the pressable

members.name: lastPressed
members.comment: The time at which this pressable was pressed

members.name: lastReleased
members.comment: The time at which this pressable was released

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructor for a pressable takes its id

members.name: isPressed
members.comment: Returns whether or not this pressable is currently being held

members.name: testAndRelease
members.comment:
Checks if this pressable is pressed
 If it is, it will mark it as released
 Returns whether this was actually pressed or not

members.name: Pressable
members.comment:
A pressable input source that stores it's own state
 State gets updated by an InputSource class that contains the pressable

members.name: allPressables
members.comment: Return a list of all of the pressables that can be accessed by the template type

members.name: getPressedPressables
members.comment: Returns a list of all of the pressables that are held down.

members.name: InputSource
members.comment:
A source of input from the user
 Handles acculmulating events and storing all the states of all the pressables
 The template parameter is the type for the identifier of all pressables

members.name: allKeyCodes
members.comment: A list of all of the key codes
members.init: [cast(SDL_Keycode)0, cast(SDL_Keycode)8, cast(SDL_Keycode)9, cast(SDL_Keycode)13, cast(SDL_Keycode)27, cast(SDL_Keycode)32, cast(SDL_Keycode)33, cast(SDL_Keycode)34, cast(SDL_Keycode)35, members.name: allKeys
members.comment: Allows allPressables to be called as allKeys

members.name: allPressables
members.comment: Returns all of the keys on the keyboard

members.name: this
members.comment: Initializes all keys of a keyboard

members.name: handleEvent
members.comment: Accumulates all of the keyboard events and updates stored pressables accordingly

members.name: Keyboard
members.comment: The keyboard input source which accumulates keyboard information

members.name: allButtonCodes
members.comment: A list of all of the button codes

members.name: allButtons
members.comment: Allows allPressables to be called as allButtons

members.name: allPressables
members.comment: Returns all of the mouse buttons

members.name: location
members.comment:
Gets the mouse location accounting for logical size or viewport
 This should be what is most regularly used

members.name: windowLocation
members.comment: Sets the location of the mouse relative to the window

members.name: windowLocation
members.comment: Gets the location of the mouse

members.name: screenLocation
members.comment: Sets the location of the mouse globally

members.name: screenLocation
members.comment: Gets the location of the mouse globally

members.name: totalWheelDisplacement
members.comment:
Gets by how much the mouse wheel has been displaced
 Records changes in wheel from the start of mouse construction

members.name: cursor
members.comment: Sets the cursor of the mouse

members.name: cursor
members.comment:
Gets the cursor of the mouse
 Special precautions must be taken when using this method:
 Make sure to store the output of the cursor or make sure the cursor doesn't get GCed
 Because the actual cursor is being used in C, D will think this returned cursor won't be being used and destroy it
 It is probably better to avoid this method entirely

members.name: this
members.comment: Makes a mouse and initializes all of the buttons

members.name: handleEvent
members.comment: Acculmulates all of the mouse events and updates stored pressables accordingly

members.name: Mouse
members.comment: The mouse input source which acculmulates mouse information

members.name: Cursor
members.comment:
A cursor is how the mouse at its location looks
 While this class should *technically* be defined in d2d.sdl2, its only use is in Mouse
 And since this class is small, instead of giving it its own file, I'll keep it here

members.name: handle
members.comment: Returns the raw SDL data of this object

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a cursor from a surface and the hotspot
 The hotspot is where on the surface is the actual mouse location

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a cursor from a predefined system cursor

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a cursor from an already SDL_Cursor

members.name: ~this
members.comment: Ensures that SDL can properly dispose of the cursor

members.name: defaultCursor
members.comment: Gets the system's default cursor

members.name: vertices
members.comment: The vertices of the polygon

members.name: sides
members.comment: Gets the sides of a polygon

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates an empty polygon

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a polygon using a list of vertices as vertices

members.name: opCast
members.comment: Casts the polygon to a polygon of another type

members.name: contains
members.comment:
Returns whether or not a given point is inside the polygon
 This algorithm uses scanlining (see Renderer.fillPolygon)
 Conceptually, it draws a ray to the left from the given point; if the ray intersects the polygon an odd number of times
 the point is within the polygon

members.name: Polygon
members.comment:
A polygon is an object defined by its vertices in 2 space
 T is the type of the polygon and sides is how many sides the polygon has
 TODO: upgrade to dimension-ambiguous model class in math

members.name: bound
members.comment: Returns the rectangle bounding a polygon

members.name: handle
members.comment: Returns the raw SDL data of this object

members.name: drawColor
members.comment: Sets the color of the renderer will draw with

members.name: drawColor
members.comment: Returns the color that the renderer will draw with

members.name: drawBlendMode
members.comment: Sets the renderer's draw blend mode that affects how the renderer draws

members.name: drawBlendMode
members.comment: Gets the renderer's draw blend mode that affects how the renderer draws

members.name: viewport
members.comment: Sets the viewport of the renderer to the given rectangle

members.name: viewport
members.comment: Gets the viewport of the renderer as a rectangle

members.name: clipRect
members.comment:
Sets the clip area for the renderer
 Anything that is rendered outside of the clip area gets discarded

members.name: clipRect
members.comment:
Gets the clip area for the renderer
 Anything that is rendered outside of the clip area gets discarded

members.name: scale
members.comment: Sets the renderer's x and y scale to the given point's x and y values

members.name: scale
members.comment: Gets the renderer's x and y scale as a point with the scales as the x and y coordinates

members.name: logicalSize
members.comment:
Sets the renderer's logical size
 Logical size works in that you only need to give coordinates for one specific resolution, and SDL will handle scaling that to the best resolution matching the logical size's aspect ratio

members.name: logicalSize
members.comment:
Gets the renderer's logical size
 Logical size works in that you only need to give coordinates for one specific resolution, and SDL will handle scaling that to the best resolution matching the logical size's aspect ratio

members.name: outputSize
members.comment: Gets the renderer's output size

members.name: info
members.comment: Gets the renderer's information and returns it as an SDL_RendererInfo struct

members.name: this
members.comment: Makes an SDL renderer for a window

members.name: this
members.comment: Makes a renderer from an already existing SDL_Renderer

members.name: ~this
members.comment: Ensures that SDL can properly dispose of the renderer

members.name: drawPoint
members.comment:
Draws a point
 Defines the fundamental draw for the shape drawer

members.name: copy
members.comment:
Copies a texture to the window at the given point
 Uses the dimensions of the given sourceRect or if not given, the dimensions of the original texture
members.originalType: void(Texture texture, int x, int y, iRectangle sourceRect = null)

members.name: copy
members.comment:
Copies a texture to the window at the given rectangle
 If sourceRect is null, it will copy the entire texture, otherwise, it will copy the slice defined by sourceRect
members.originalType: void(Texture texture, iRectangle destinationRect, iRectangle sourceRect = null)

members.name: copy
members.comment:
Copies a texture to the window at the given rectangle with the given angle
 If sourceRect is null, it will copy the entire texture, otherwise, it will copy the slice defined by sourceRect
 Angles are given in radians
members.originalType: void(Texture texture, iRectangle destinationRect, double angle, SDL_RendererFlip flip = SDL_FLIP_NONE, iVector center = null, iRectangle sourceRect = null)

members.name: clear
members.comment: Fills the screen with the existing renderer color

members.name: present
members.comment: Updates what the renderer has drawn by actually outputting or presenting it

members.name: Renderer
members.comment:
Renderers are objects that handle drawing things such as textures or shapes
 A renderer can be obtained from a window, and could be used to draw on the window
 Renderers draw using buffers; when a renderer draws, it isn't visible to the screen until the present method is called
 While most of these functions are ported directly off of LibSDL2, most of them have been renamed into standard OOP convention
 Many SDL functions are now property methods (eg. SDL_SetRenderDrawColor => renderer.drawColor = ...)
 All functions defined in renderer are based off of SDL functions and SDL documentation can be viewed as well

members.name: ShapeDrawer
members.comment: A utility class to provide math drawing utilities

members.name: drawColor
members.comment: Sets the color that the ShapeDrawer will draw at

members.name: drawColor
members.comment: Gets the color that the ShapeDrawer will draw at

members.name: drawPoint
members.comment:
Shape drawer needs only one fundamental draw methods to be defined:
 point, which all other shape drawer fill and draw methods use
 Other methods below can be overridden if there exists more efficient sdl method

members.name: drawPointRotated
members.comment: Draws a point rotated about the given "pointOfRotation" and rotated clockwise by the the amount of radians specified in "rotation"

members.name: drawRotated
members.comment: Performs a draw function but rotates each point by the specified rotation given in radians clockwise around the specified point

members.name: drawLine
members.comment:
Draws a line
 Can be overridden

members.name: drawRect
members.comment:
Draws the outlines of a rectangle
 Can be overridden

members.name: fillRect
members.comment:
Fills in a rectangle
 Can be overridden

members.name: draw
members.comment:
Draws a point to the screen
 Just calls the basic draw point method

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a point to the screen

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a point given by a vector

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a point given by a vector

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a line given by two points

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a line given by two points
members.originalType: void(iVector first, iVector second, Color color)

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a line given by a segment

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a line given by a segment

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws the given rectangle

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws the given rectangle

members.name: fill
members.comment: Fills the given rectangle

members.name: fill
members.comment: Fills the given rectangle

members.name: draw
members.comment:
Draws the given bezier curve with numPoints number of points on the curve
 More points is smoother but slower

members.name: draw
members.comment:
Draws the given bezier curve with numPoints number of points on the curve
 More points is smoother but slower

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a polygon

members.name: draw
members.comment: Draws a polygon

members.name: fill
members.comment:
Fills a polygon
 Uses scanlining

members.name: fill
members.comment:
Fills a polygon
 Uses scanlining

members.name: draw
members.type: void(iRectangle bounds, double startAngle, double endAngle)

members.name: draw
members.comment:
Draws the ellipse bounded by the given box between the given angles in radians
 More points generally means a slower but more well drawn ellipse

members.name: draw
members.type: void(iRectangle bounds, double startAngle, double endAngle, Color color)

members.name: draw
members.comment:
Draws the ellipse bounded by the given box between the given angles in radians
 More points generally means a slower but more well drawn ellipse

members.name: fill
members.type: void(iRectangle bounds, double startAngle, double endAngle)

members.name: fill
members.comment:
Fills the ellipse bounded by the given box between the given angles in radians
 Fills the ellipse between the arc endpoints: fills ellipse as arc rather than filling as ellipse (not a pizza slice)
 More points generally means a slower but more well drawn ellipse

members.name: fill
members.type: void(iRectangle bounds, double startAngle, double endAngle, Color color)

members.name: fill
members.comment:
Fills the ellipse bounded by the given box between the given angles in radians
 Fills the ellipse between the arc endpoints: fills ellipse as arc rather than filling as ellipse (not a pizza slice)
 More points generally means a slower but more well drawn ellipse

members.name: SoundType
members.comment:
The two types of sounds there are
 Chunks are for sound effects and for shorter sounds
 Musics are for longer sounds such as background music
 Multiple chunks can play at once, but only one music can be playing at a time

members.name: this
members.comment:
Makes the sound given the string of the path of the sound
 If this is a music sound, the music will loop; otherwise if this is a chunk, the chunk will play once

members.name: Sound
members.comment:
A sound is, as its name suggests, something that can be played and make a noise
 Sounds are templated and can either be chunks or musics
 A chunk sound is a short sound that is usually a sound effect or something quick; many chunks can play at once
 A chunk will only play once
 A music is something that usually plays for longer and is usually something like background music; only one sound can play at once
 A music will loop infinitely until destroyed
 This sound is a primitive port from SDL and doesn't allow for much control
 There is no constructor for a sound from an already existing Mix_Chunk or Mix_Music because it may have unintended behaviour

members.name: pause
members.comment:
Pauses all sounds of a type
 There is no implementation to pause certain sounds selectively
 Only the music is individually controllable
 For chunks, chunks are collectively paused and unpaused

members.name: resume
members.comment:
Resumes all sounds of a type
 There is no implementation to resume certain sounds selectively
 Only the music is individually controllable
 For chunks, chunks are collectively paused and unpaused

members.name: chunkVolume
members.comment:
Sets the volume that all chunks will play at
 Chunks are all at the same volume; there is no implementation to control the volume of an individual chunk
 TODO possibly implement Mix_VolumeChunk?

members.name: chunkVolume
members.comment:
Gets the volume that all chunks will play at
 Chunks are all at the same volume; there is no implementation to control the volume of an individual chunk
 TODO possibly implement Mix_VolumeChunk?

members.name: musicVolume
members.comment: Sets the volume that the music will play at

members.name: musicVolume
members.comment: Gets the volume that the music will play at

members.name: drawColor
members.comment: Sets the drawcolor for this surface; what color things will be drawn with

members.name: drawColor
members.comment: Gets the drawcolor for this surface; what color things will be drawn with

members.name: handle
members.comment: Returns the raw SDL data of this object

members.name: dimensions
members.comment: Gets the surfaces dimensions as a vector with width as the x component and height as the y component

members.name: alphaMod
members.comment:
Sets the alpha modifier for the surface
 Alpha modification works by multiplying the alphaMultiplier / 255 into the surface pixels

members.name: alphaMod
members.comment:
Gets the alpha modifier for the surface
 Alpha modification works by multiplying the alphaMultiplier / 255 into the surface pixels

members.name: blendMode
members.comment: Sets the surface's blend mode

members.name: blendMode
members.comment: Gets the surface's blend mode

members.name: clipRect
members.comment:
Sets the clip boundaries for the surface
 Anything put on the surface outside of the clip boundaries gets discarded

members.name: clipRect
members.comment:
Gets the clip boundaries for the surface
 Anything put on the surface outside of the clip boundaries gets discarded

members.name: colorMod
members.comment:
Sets the color modifier for the surface
 Color modification works by multiplying the colorMultiplier / 255 into the surface pixels

members.name: colorMod
members.comment:
Gets the color modifier for the surface
 Color modification works by multiplying the colorMultiplier / 255 into the surface pixels

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates an RGB surface given at least a width and a height
members.originalType: (int width, int height, int depth = 32, uint flags = 0, uint Rmask = 0, uint Gmask = 0, uint Bmask = 0, uint Amask = 0)

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates an RGB surface given at least a width, height, and an SDL_PixelFormatEnum
members.originalType: (int width, int height, uint format, int depth = 32, uint flags = 0)

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a surface from another surface but with a different pixel format

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a surface from another surface but with a different pixel format

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a surface from a BMP file path; for other image formats, use loadImage

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a surface from an already existing SDL_Surface

members.name: ~this
members.comment: Ensures that SDL can properly dispose of the surface

members.name: drawPoint
members.comment:
Defines how the shape drawer draws points on a surface
 Used for all other shape drawer functions

members.name: fillRect
members.comment:
Fills in a rectangle
 Uses the SDL functionality for better performance

members.name: saveBMP
members.comment: Saves the surface as a BMP with the given file name

members.name: blit
members.comment:
Blits another surface onto this surface
 Takes the surface to blit, the slice of the surface to blit, and where on this surface to blit to
 Is faster than a scaled blit to a rectangle
members.originalType: void(Surface src, iRectangle srcRect, int dstX, int dstY)

members.name: blit
members.comment:
Does a scaled blit from another surface onto this surface
 Takes the surface to blit, the slice of the surface to blit, and the slice on this surface of where to blit to
 Is slower than the blit to a location
members.originalType: void(Surface src, iRectangle srcRect, iRectangle dstRect)

members.name: Surface
members.comment:
Surfaces are a rectangular collection of pixels
 Surfaces are easy to work with and edit and can be blitted on to another surface
 Surfaces can also be converted to textures which are more efficient but less flexible
 Surfaces are handled in software as opposed to textures which are handled in hardware
 Surfaces can be used, but when used repeatedly and stored, textures should be preferred
 Surface draw methods do not respect alpha, but surface blitting does; to draw with alpha, draw to another surface, and blit to desired surface

members.name: loadImage
members.comment: Uses the SDL_Image library to create a non-bmp image surface

members.name: scaled
members.comment:
Returns a surface that fits the given rectangle
 Fits the original surface within the returned surface to be as large as it can while maintaining aspect ratio
 Also centers the original surface within the returned surface

members.name: Texture
members.comment:
Textures are a rectangular collection of pixels
 Textures are fast and can be drawn using a renderer
 Textures can be created from a more easily edited surface
 Textures are handled in hardware as opposed to surfaces which are handled in software
 When used repeatedly and stored, textures should be preferred, but surfaces should be used when flexibility is desired

members.name: handle
members.comment: Returns the raw SDL data of this object

members.name: dimensions
members.comment: Gets the texture's dimensions as a point with the width being the x coordinate and the height being the y coordinate

members.name: format
members.comment:
Gets the texture's pixel format
 The pixel format is the format in which information about the pixels is stored (e.g. RGBA)

members.name: access
members.comment:
Gets the texture's access value
 Acces value determines how the texture can be accessed or modified
 Potential values are:
 SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STATIC: texture changes rarely, and is not lockable
 SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_STREAMING: texture changes frequently, and is lockable
 SDL_TEXTUREACCESS_TARGET: texturecan be used as a render target

members.name: alphaMod
members.comment:
Sets the texture's alpha value, or transparency, if possible
 Alpha varies from 0 to 255

members.name: alphaMod
members.comment:
Gets the texture's alpha value, or transparency, if possible
 Alpha varies from 0 to 255

members.name: blendMode
members.comment:
Sets the texture's blend mode
 Modes include:
 SDL_BLENDMODE_NONE: no blending
 SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND: alpha blending
 SDL_BLENDMODE_ADD: additive blending
 SDL_BLENDMODE_MOD: color modulate

members.name: blendMode
members.comment:
Gets the texture's blend mode
 Modes include:
 SDL_BLENDMODE_NONE: no blending
 SDL_BLENDMODE_BLEND: alpha blending
 SDL_BLENDMODE_ADD: additive blending
 SDL_BLENDMODE_MOD: color modulate

members.name: colorMod
members.comment:
Sets the color modifier for the surface
 Color modification works by multiplying the colorMultiplier / 255 into the surface pixels

members.name: colorMod
members.comment:
Gets the color modifier for the surface
 Color modification works by multiplying the colorMultiplier / 255 into the surface pixels

members.name: this
members.comment:
Creates a texture given explicit parameters that are required by SDL CreateTexture
 Allows for more control over how the texture works
members.originalType: (Renderer renderer, uint format, SDL_TextureAccess access, int width, int height)

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructs a new texture from a surface

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates a texture from an already existing SDL_Texture

members.name: ~this
members.comment: Ensures that SDL can properly dispose of the texture

members.name: lock
members.comment: Locks a texture from editing
members.originalType: void(void** pixels, int* pitch, iRectangle location = null)

members.name: unlock
members.comment: Unlocks a texture to edit

members.name: update
members.comment: Updates a texture with new pixel data
members.originalType: void(void* pixels, int pitch, iRectangle location = null)

members.name: Window
members.comment:
A window is, as it name suggests, a window
 This window class is extremely minimalistic and is a port of the SDL_Window

members.name: handle
members.comment: Returns the raw SDL data of this object

members.name: brightness
members.comment: Sets the window's brightness or gama multiplier

members.name: brightness
members.comment: Gets the window's brightness or gama multiplier

members.name: displayMode
members.comment: Sets the display mode of this window

members.name: displayMode
members.comment: Gets the display mode of this window

members.name: grab
members.comment: Sets whether the window grabs input or not

members.name: grab
members.comment: Gets whether the window grabs input or not

members.name: maximumSize
members.comment: Sets the window's maximum size

members.name: maximumSize
members.comment: Gets the window's maximum size

members.name: minimumSize
members.comment: Sets the window's minimum size

members.name: minimumSize
members.comment: Gets the window's minimum size

members.name: size
members.comment: Sets the window's size

members.name: size
members.comment: Gets the window's size

members.name: opacity
members.comment: Sets the window's opacity

members.name: opacity
members.comment: Gets the window's opacity

members.name: position
members.comment: Sets the window's screen position

members.name: position
members.comment: Gets the window's screen position

members.name: title
members.comment: Sets the window's title

members.name: title
members.comment: Gets the window's title

members.name: icon
members.comment: Sets the window's icon

members.name: info
members.comment:
Gets the information about the window
 Returns an array of all the flags that describe this window

members.name: renderer
members.comment:
Gets the window's renderer
 This function shouldn't be used because this function returns a renderer object
 Once the returned object gets garbage collected, it deletes all instances of this window's renderer

members.name: this
members.comment: Constructor for a window; needs at least a width and a height
members.originalType: (int w, int h, SDL_WindowFlags flags = SDL_WINDOW_SHOWN, string title = "", int x = SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED, int y = SDL_WINDOWPOS_CENTERED)

members.name: this
members.comment: Creates the window from an already existing SDL_Window

members.name: ~this
members.comment: Ensures that SDL can properly dispose of the window

members.name: setAsModalFor
members.comment: Marks the current window as a modal for the given parent window

members.name: setBordered
members.comment:
Sets whether the window should be bordered or not
 Is not a property method because it is a setter without a getter

members.name: setResizable
members.comment:
Sets whether the window should be resizable or not
 Is not a property method because it is a setter without a getter

members.name: hide
members.comment: Hides the window

members.name: show
members.comment: Shows the window

members.name: maximize
members.comment: Maximizes the window

members.name: minimize
members.comment: Minimizes window in terms of size

members.name: restore
members.comment: Restores a window to its original state before a maximize or minimize

members.name: raise
members.comment: Moves the window to be on top of everything else and to have the focus

members.name: loadLibSDL
members.comment:
Loads base DerelictSDL2
 Function can be called many times, but load only happens once

members.name: loadLibImage
members.comment:
Loads SDL_Image libraries
 Function can be called many times, but load only happens once

members.name: loadLibMixer
members.comment:
Loads SDL_Mixer libraries
 Function can be called many times, but load only happens once

members.name: loadLibTTF
members.comment:
Loads SDL_ttf libraries
 Function can be called many times, but load only happens once

members.name: ensureSafe
members.comment:
Takes in an integer output from an SDL function and then throws an error if the integer isn't 0
 Because SDL doesn't throw errors, but rather returns codes, 0 means a successful finish to a function
 Any non-zero output from a function means that SDL encountered an error, and this function will throw upon an SDL error

members.name: ensureSafe
members.comment:
Takes in an object from an SDL function and then throws an error if the object is null
 Because SDL doesn't throw errors upon failed object creation, but constructs the object as a null, a non-null object means a successful creation
 Any null creation means that SDL encountered an error, and this function will throw an SDL error accordingly

members.name: handle
members.comment: Gets a 2d vector as an SDL_Point*

members.name: handle
members.comment: Gets a 2d axis aligned bounding box as an SDL_Rect*

members.name: toPolygon
members.comment: Gets a 2d axis aligned bounding box as a polygon
